TextEquiv.Unicode: Te beleeve therefore that our Lorde
Jesus Christ in that day shall deliver
all the godly ad destroy alye wicked:
according to the wordes of hte Apostle
who saythrOur Lord shall be revealed
fro heaven with the Angels of his peo
wer, with a burning slame, and shall
lay vengeance on them that have not
knowne God: And againe, the same
just judge shall give a crowne of righ
teousnesse to all them that love his co
ming. The manner of this judgement
the writings of the Evangelistes & A
postles doe tell us, shall be in this fort,
When once the wickednesse of this
world shall come to the full, & that An
tichrist shall have deceived the world,
so that there is but little faith remai
ning, & that the wicked shall say peace
and auitnesse, then shall a sodaine de
structio come. For our Lord the judge
shall sende his Archangel, to blowe the
trump & to gather together from the
foure winds al flesh to judgemet: by &
by after shall the judge him selfe our
Lord Jesus Christ follow with all the
hoast of heaven: & he shall descend out
of heaven into the cloudes: and fitting
aloft in the cloudes as in a judgement
seate, shalbe easilie seene of al flesh For
they that shall bee then living at the
day of judgement shall in a very prick
of time be changed, & stande before the
indge: and all the deade shall in a mo
ment rise up againe. Then shall the
judge divide the sheepe from the goats:
& according to justice shal give iudge
met with the sheep & against the goats
saying. Come ye blessed Ec. And, Goe
ye cursed. Zc. Presently after shall fol
lowe executlon. For the sheepe shall by
and by be caught up into the clouds to
meete ye Lord in the ayre, & shal ascend
with him oyfully into heaven to the
right hand of God the father, there to
live for ever in glorie & gladnesse. The

Te beleeve therefore that our Lorde Jesus Christ in that day shall deliver all the godly ad destroy alye wicked: according to the wordes of hte Apostle who saythrOur Lord shall be revealed fro heaven with the Angels of his peo wer, with a burning slame, and shall lay vengeance on them that have not knowne God: And againe, the same just judge shall give a crowne of righ teousnesse to all them that love his co ming. The manner of this judgement the writings of the Evangelistes & A postles doe tell us, shall be in this fort, When once the wickednesse of this world shall come to the full, & that An tichrist shall have deceived the world, so that there is but little faith remai ning, & that the wicked shall say peace and auitnesse, then shall a sodaine de structio come. For our Lord the judge shall sende his Archangel, to blowe the trump & to gather together from the foure winds al flesh to judgemet: by & by after shall the judge him selfe our Lord Jesus Christ follow with all the hoast of heaven: & he shall descend out of heaven into the cloudes: and fitting aloft in the cloudes as in a judgement seate, shalbe easilie seene of al flesh For they that shall bee then living at the day of judgement shall in a very prick of time be changed, & stande before the indge: and all the deade shall in a mo ment rise up againe. Then shall the judge divide the sheepe from the goats: & according to justice shal give iudge met with the sheep & against the goats saying. Come ye blessed Ec. And, Goe ye cursed. Zc. Presently after shall fol lowe executlon. For the sheepe shall by and by be caught up into the clouds to meete ye Lord in the ayre, & shal ascend with him oyfully into heaven to the right hand of God the father, there to live for ever in glorie & gladnesse. The
bottome of the earth shall gape for the
wicked, & shall sucke them all by hor
ribly, & send them downe to hell, there
to be tormented for ever with Satan
and his angels. All this shall be done
not by any long, troublesom, or chage
able processe, as is used in our Courts
of lawe, but even in the twinckling of
an eye. For then shall all mens hearts
be laide open & everie mans own con
science shall accuse himselfe. This is
more at lage set out in Mat. 246 25.
is3. & 51. Cor. 152. Cor, 57. The
45. Rom. 2 2. Pet. 26c. Nowe we doe
simply confesse that the quicke and the
dead shalbe judged. This doe some ex
pound of the godly & ungodly. But the
Symbole or Creede, was ordeyned for
the most simple of understanding. And
simple thinges are fittest for to teach
simple men. Therefore we say simply ye
the dead are all they, that from the be
ginning of the worlde even untill the
last day are departed out of this mor
tall life. And the living are they which
at that day shalbe alive in this world.
For the Apostle saith: Behold I tell yon
a mysterie, we shall not all sleepe, but
wee shall all be channged by the last
trump in a moment of time and in the
twinckling of an eye. For the trumpe
shal sounde, and the dead shall rise a
gaine incorruptible, and wee shall bee
chaunged.
And again in another place the same
Aposile sayth: This l say unto you in
the worde of the Lord, that we, which
shal line and be remaining at the com
ming of the Lorde, shall not prevent
them which are a sleepe. Because the
Lorde himelfe shall come downe out
of heaven with a great noyse, and the
voice of an Archangell and the trumy
of God, and first shall the deade in
Christ rise, up againe, then shall we
which shall be alive and be remaining,

bottome of the earth shall gape for the wicked, & shall sucke them all by hor ribly, & send them downe to hell, there to be tormented for ever with Satan and his angels. All this shall be done not by any long, troublesom, or chage able processe, as is used in our Courts of lawe, but even in the twinckling of an eye. For then shall all mens hearts be laide open & everie mans own con science shall accuse himselfe. This is more at lage set out in Mat. 246 25. is3. & 51. Cor. 152. Cor, 57. The 45. Rom. 2 2. Pet. 26c. Nowe we doe simply confesse that the quicke and the dead shalbe judged. This doe some ex pound of the godly & ungodly. But the Symbole or Creede, was ordeyned for the most simple of understanding. And simple thinges are fittest for to teach simple men. Therefore we say simply ye the dead are all they, that from the be ginning of the worlde even untill the last day are departed out of this mor tall life. And the living are they which at that day shalbe alive in this world. For the Apostle saith: Behold I tell yon a mysterie, we shall not all sleepe, but wee shall all be channged by the last trump in a moment of time and in the twinckling of an eye. For the trumpe shal sounde, and the dead shall rise a gaine incorruptible, and wee shall bee chaunged. And again in another place the same Aposile sayth: This l say unto you in the worde of the Lord, that we, which shal line and be remaining at the com ming of the Lorde, shall not prevent them which are a sleepe. Because the Lorde himelfe shall come downe out of heaven with a great noyse, and the voice of an Archangell and the trumy of God, and first shall the deade in Christ rise, up againe, then shall we which shall be alive and be remaining,
